data.title: Morrison Center Advisory Board
data.text:
Katya Andresen

Senior Vice President and Chief Digital & Analytics Officer

The Cigna Group

Katya Andresen serves as The Cigna Group’s Chief Digital & Analytics Officer. In this position, she leads digital strategy and data and analytics for the company’s lines of business as well as cross- enterprise experiences to improve the health and vitality of those we serve.

Prior to joining Cigna in September 2021, Katya drove experience innovation in financial services as a Senior Vice President at Capital One, focusing on creating and delivering an integrated, end-to-end experience for customers across all touchpoints with a team that included customer insights, digital product and experience, brand, digital marketing, content marketing, design, servicing, and Capital One Cafes. Before joining Capital One, Katya served in executive roles for mission-focused technology companies, as CEO of the education technology company Cricket Media and COO and CSO of Network for Good, a payments platform and SaaS enterprise solution for digital giving and social actions that was founded by AOL, Yahoo! and Cisco. Katya guest lectures at Georgetown University’s business school and has served as an adjunct professor at the American University Key Executive Leadership Program. Earlier in her career, Katya was a foreign correspondent for Reuters News and Television in Asia and for Associated Press and major U.S. newspapers in Africa. Katya holds a B.A. in History from Haverford College.

Andrew Appel

CEO

AppCapital

Andrew Appel is a seasoned business leader, CEO, and trusted advisor with over 25 years of management experience. He's significantly contributed to various industries, including consulting, public companies, and private equity-backed data and analytics firms. Appel is renowned for his transformational business acumen, strategic alignment of senior teams, and execution of complex M&A transactions. He fosters strong internal and external communications and builds global cross-functional teams that drive value and transformation.

In 2021, Appel founded App Capital, an organization dedicated to the digital transformation of businesses in information services and consumer packaged goods (CPG). App Capital collaborates with top-tier private equity firms on active transactions, ranging from $2 billion to $12 billion, in technology data, analytics, and CPG markets. Appel also serves as an advisor to multiple data and technology companies. companies, including CC Capital, E2Open, Harmonya, Premise, Zeta Global, I-Genie.Ai, 8090 (rebranded Era Funds), and CoolerScreens, while engaging in special projects with SymphonyAI.

From 2012 to 2021, Appel served as President and CEO of IRI, overseeing its transformation from an insights provider into a technology-focused Big Data global company. During his tenure, he substantially expanded IRI's retail presence, securing relationships with most US retailers and achieving record-breaking financial performance from 2012 - 2021, nearly tripping revenue while increasing margin.

In 2017, Appel played a key role in supporting Blackstone's $4.8 billion acquisition of a business, serving on the board until its recent de-SPAC in July 2021.

Before joining IRI, Appel was Senior VP of Revenue Operations at Accretive Health, a rapidly growing healthcare services company, and a vital member of Aon's Executive Committee. He served as CEO of Aon Consulting and Aon Benfield from 2005 to 2010, achieving operational excellence and substantial financial growth, bolstering Aon's position in human resource consulting and outsourcing.

His career began at McKinsey and Company, where he spent 15 years advising global financial institutions and co-founded McKinsey's Global Business Technology and Operations Practice.

Appel currently serves as Lead Director on the Board of Constant Contact and the Board of Advisors for the UCLA Anderson School of Business. He has held board roles at IRI, Machine Vantage, Alight, World Business Chicago, and the Joffrey Ballet.

Appel holds a bachelor's degree in economics from UCLA and an MBA from the University of Chicago, where he was the Henry Ford II Scholar. He resides with his family in the Chicagoland area.

Catherine Bension

Chief Executive Officer Select

Resources International

Catherine joined SelectResources International (SRI) in 1997 following a 22-year career that included significant stints as both a client and an agency executive. Today the company is seen as the premier strategic search consulting firm in the country, having managed and completed over 600 reviews, searches and consulting projects involving over $40+ billion in media billings., Sixty-five of the 200 largest marketers in NA have been an SRI client. (AdAge 2021 Fact Book)

Catherine began her career in movie marketing. Later as CMO for Universal Studios’ Recreation Group, she laid the groundwork for the company’s successful expansion into the Florida market. Catherine’s agency experience spanned senior management roles at a number of agencies, DDB Worldwide, FCB Worldwide, and Ogilvy among them. Over her 20+ year tenure at SelectResources International she has worked for a range of clients in categories ranging from beauty, beverage, food/CPG, retail, restaurant, telecommunications, technology, travel and leisure, healthcare, financial services and automotive.

Catherine received her MBA from UCLA’s Anderson School of Management. She is an active member of the national advertising community and frequent speaker at various industry events. In 2002 she was selected by AdAge as one of its “20 Women to Watch”.

Keith Camoosa

Chief Product & Technology Innovation Officer Chief Product & Technology Innovation Officer

Acxiom

Keith is an industry leader with over 25 years of experience in data analytics, marketing, and technology enablement. In his current position as the Chief Addressability Officer at dentsu, he drives dentsu’s product strategy and provides brands with thought leadership on how to effectively leverage first-party data, marketing technology, data science, and connected-cloud workflows to drive business growth with omnichannel marketing.

Prior to joining dentsu, Keith held leadership positions at WarnerMedia and IPG, where he designed and managed multidisciplinary data organizations. At WarnerMedia, he partnered with corporate and cross-functional leaders to initiate the use of predictive analytics, in-pipeline machine learning, identity management, and marketing technology in support of marketing, content decision-making, subscriber lifecycle management, and business operations for the firm’s streaming services, movie releases, and TV shows. During his tenure at IPG, Keith created and operationalized an innovative audience-first marketing platform solution, AMP. AMP revolutionized the use of identity resolution and big data technologies in advertising media enabling marketer customer intelligence to be leveraged for the identification of growth audiences, budget allocation, partner selection, and closed-loop measurement at scale. The AMP solution contributed to IPG’s $2.3B acquisition of Acxiom and comScore’s $732M acquisition of Rentrak.

He also held insights & analytics positions at TNS, Yahoo!, and Deutsch.

Keith has a degree in History & Political Science from Villanova University, and today serves as an advisor to marketing data technology start-ups. He is an advocate for progress and innovation through diversity, collaboration, continuous learning, and mentorship within the data marketing community.

Qiaolin Chen

Chief Scientist

Tencent Games

Dr. Qiaolin Chen, currently serving as the Head of Global Data Intelligence and Tech Solutions, and the Chief Scientist at Tencent Global Data Team, has decade-long experience in big data and machine learning. With her expertise in data engineering, data science, and data products, she has led various data-driven projects, highlighting the potential of data as a problem-solving tool.

After joining Tencent in 2018, Qiaolin initiated the company's first global data team, now comprising members from the US, Europe, Singapore, and many other countries. She has been instrumental in building data applications and designing professional solutions such as A/B testing, Personalized User Operations, Uplift Modelling, User Profiling, and LTV predictions. These efforts have been key in enhancing business scenarios such as user growth, refined operations, advertising and commercialization, product development, and recommendation systems.

Before joining Tencent, Qiaolin sharpened her data skills at Novartis and SparkBeyond, following her academic journey where she obtained a B.S. degree from Peking University and a Ph.D. in Biostatistics from UCLA.

Her contributions to Tencent Global and the data community are highlighted by her role on the Board Committee of UCLA Anderson School's Morris Center of Marketing Analytics.

Carl Hartman

Global Client Leader IPG

Carl Hartman has explored many areas of the advertising and marketing communications landscape. The majority of his career was spent at the world's largest communications firm, WPP where he led agencies - CEO of Geometry Global, CEO of WPP@CP - and led major WPP clients as a global client leader - Colgate-Palmolive, Kimberly-Clark. He also led WPP's new business efforts in the shopper space winning clients like Unilever, General Mills, Mondelez, Kimberly-Clark and Coca-Cola with integrated, multi-agency solutions. He created and ran the successful WPP Commerce event, which is now in its tenth year. Carl also led the Verizon business at another holding company, IPG. Carl currently teaches advertising and marketing communications at the UCLA Anderson School of Management MBA program. He is on the advisory boards of Evergreen Trading and the Linqia influencer platform. Carl also serves on the board of EHS Educational Housing Systems, a nonprofit creating affordable housing for NYC college students. Carl lives in Charleston, SC with his wife, Jamie. He has two sons, Hudson and Wyatt and one pug, Elvis.

Phil Leslie

Vice President

Amazon

Phil Leslie is a Vice President at Amazon where he leads a team of economists and scientists that develop strategic science for Amazon’s advertising and entertainment businesses. His work addresses the measurement and optimization of advertising campaigns, design of advertising products including ad auction design, advertising in Prime Video, and the economics of the Amazon Prime bundle. Prior to joining Amazon in 2015, Phil was a professor at UCLA Anderson where he taught business strategy and did research in the economics of industries, firms and pricing; and prior to that he was a professor at Stanford’s Graduate School of Business. He has a PhD in economics from Yale University, has numerous publications in leading economics and marketing journals; and he was a founder of Hazel Analytics, a food safety analytics company, that was acquired by Ecolab in 2023. Phil is originally from Australia and now lives in Seattle.

Wes Nichols

Partner

March Capital

Wes Nichols is Partner of LA-based March Capital, in addition to being an active investor and board advisor to public and private company CEOs. Wes is an industry authority in predictive analytics, marketing, AI/machine learning, and digital transformation, with a robust global network of C-Suite executives of many of the world’s largest companies. Wes was the author of the Harvard Business Review cover story, Analytics 2.0, on next-generation analytics to drive more predictive decision-making, with a follow-up article underway currently.

A two-time entrepreneur, Wes has created high profile analytics software companies with a focus on enterprise SaaS. Most recently, Wes was co-founder and CEO of MarketShare. MarketShare’s analytics SaaS solutions are now the world’s largest software solution for C-Suite resource allocation, budget planning and revenue attribution. MarketShare was backed by FTV Capital, Elevation Partners and Silver Lake Partners. In a competitive process with many of the world’s largest software companies, the company was acquired by Neustar, the leading company in authenticated identity, where the MarketShare team took leadership roles throughout the company and Wes became Chief Strategy Officer. Neustar was acquired by Golden Gate Capital within a year of the MarketShare acquisition. Wes is currently a Board Director of Neustar.

Prior, he was the founder and CEO of Direct Partners, building from scratch one of the industry’s first data-driven analytics and CRM companies, which was acquired by Omnicom Group (NYSE: OMC), where he then became President and CEO of the digital business at TBWA, serving Sony, Pfizer, Apple, Nissan and others.

Wes is a Board Director and Chair of the Compensation Committee of TrueCar (NASDAQ: TRUE), Board Director of Neustar, AI semantics software Persado, Enterprise CDP company ActionIQ, data insights company Disqo, and healthcare AI company Suki. Wes also volunteers with non-profits like charter school organization Green Dot and the Los Angeles Police Department’s community programs. Wes is the 2016 winner of the EY Entrepreneur of the Year Award and was nominated as a Technology Pioneer by the World Economic Forum (WEF).

Wes graduated from Randolph-Macon College and The Johns Hopkins University, with degrees in Psychology and Business, respectively, and graduated from the President’s Program in Leadership (PPL) at the Harvard Business School.

Prema Sampath

Director of Product Management

Meta

Prema Sampath is currently a Director of Product Management at Meta leading the Advertiser Experience for Ads Platforms. In her capacity she oversees Ads Manager, Ads Manager App, Marketing API and platforms that support overall Ads experience including bringing AI-enabled experiences to drive optimal outcomes for Advertisers. Previously she was at Google in the Ads division where she led products focussed on measurement of Brand Advertising such as MMM, Lift and Audience measurement, marketing insights and ground-truth platforms for Ads customers. Prema oversaw a portfolio of Digital and Cross-media measurement products that spans both Google-enabled solutions as well as third-party measurement of Google Display, and Video inventory via Ads Data Hub. She als led the development, launch, and subsequent scaling of industry-leading privacy-centric cloud-based analytics and measurement solutions called Ads Data Hub. She served on the board of Media Ratings Council and led Google's participation at the World Federation of Advertisers X-media measurement industry initiative.

Prema has been in the digital marketing and advertising space for a decade and at Google, has previously led strategy and operations as well as product teams focused on collaboration tools and measurement solutions for inventory across Google Ads and DV360. Prior to Google, she served as Director of Marketing Analytics at Netflix and subsequently in leadership roles at YP.com (formerly a portfolio company of Cerberus Capital Management) as Vice President of Product for Ads platforms, and Customer Strategy. After business school, Prema was a management consultant at Bain and Co. in the Los Angeles Office advising clients in the Technology and Media space.
